alert.note: Alert for Miami-Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 06 at 6:19PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 617 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rains moving northeast from the Everglades into the southern metro areas of Miami-Dade County. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen from the earlier heavy rains today, and additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected from these heavy rains. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood Warning may be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Homestead, Coral Gables, The Redland, Black Point, Kendall, Florida City, Princeton, Goulds, Naranja, Richmond West, Leisure City, Homestead Base, Zoo Miami, Country Walk, West Perrine, Cutler Bay, Richmond Heights, Palmetto Bay, South Miami Heights and Inlikita. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely.
